elements.title: Grotto of Our Lady of Lourdes at the University of Notre Dame (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Grotto of Our Lady of Lourdes at the University of Notre Dame (pictured) contains two stones originally from the grotto at which Our Lady of Lourdes is said to have appeared to Saint Bernadette?

elements.title: an Ohio TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the "You've Got Mail" voice actor was one of dozens of people fired from an Ohio TV station after its takeover by Paxson Communications?

elements.title: Paul Freeman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Paul Freeman became one of the few Westerners interred at the Kremlin Wall Necropolis, following his death in an experimental propeller-driven Soviet railcar?

elements.title: Statistics of Deadly Quarrels (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lewis Fry Richardson's Statistics of Deadly Quarrels suggested that the establishment of a world government might end wars?

elements.title: murder of Vivianne Ruiz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a bloodied fingerprint on newspaper was the central piece of evidence in the murder of Vivianne Ruiz?

elements.title: her own award-winning poem (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sylvia Plath criticized her own award-winning poem for its "old crystal-brittle and sugar-faceted voice"?

elements.title: Edward A. Hanna (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Edward A. Hanna wanted to eliminate the New York State Assembly while he served in it, and later wanted to close down the government of the city of Utica while he was its mayor?

elements.title: Pulaski's Masterpiece (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Pulaski's Masterpiece, billed as the "world's most valuable dog", disappeared without a trace in 1953?
